alert.note: Alert for Mobile Inland (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 05 at 4:19PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Mobile, George, southeastern Perry, southern Greene and Stone Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 419 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles east of Beaumont to 4 miles southwest of McLain to 9 miles east of Maxie to Wiggins. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wiggins, Lucedale, Perkinston, McHenry and McLain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
